result.execSummary:
The defendant Lori A Ellis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt:
9:41 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will accept the offer.  DA recites offer - upon plea to the two counts of Theft in 2016CM28 and a plea to one count of IOWC, will recommend probation.  Defendant concurs, but is contesting the restitution.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to 2016CM28 & GUILTY to 2015CM271.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 2 as charged on 2016CM28 and finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged on 2015CM271.  Court orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to(Ct 1-2015CM271 & Ct 1-2016CM28):

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 18 months.

CONDITIONS (EACH):

-Court costs.
-2016CM28 - Court sets for restitution hearing on June 6, 2016 at 9:00 a.m.
-2015CM271 - Restitution of $828.77
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 9:55 a.m.

Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTYon behalf of the defendant.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant to stop at the DA's office to make appointment.  Court will set for Status Hearing on January 11, 2016 at 9:30 a.m.
